result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa A Haefner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit for 3 day were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.   Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Sign all release for Agent.

No contact with Cory C.  Other contact with underage persons be approved by Agent.
Supervised placement with M.H. (12/20/2001) at the discretion of the Agent.  Follow any terms and conditions set by any other court regarding minor child.
Department of Corrections to petition the Juvenile Court for evaluation done.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AMENDED 8/15/2016: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH M.H. (12/20/2001) AS AGREED BY MS. HAEFNER AND THE FATHER OF M.H. IN WAUKESHA COUNTY FAMILY CASE 16FA597/

timeConds.notes: Huber with Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions - To commence FORTHWITH, Last 10 days are STAYED, for use at Agent's discretion.  Defendant may have a phone call to arrange child care arrangements.

Defendant Lisa A Haefner in court with attorney Ehrfurth for Donna Jean Kuchler.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Suha makes statements requesting the supervised visitation remains.  Court makes statements.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements. Defendant makes statements.  

Court amends the JOC to the following:  

Contact with MH dob: 12/20/2001:  as agreed by Ms. Haefner and the father of MH in Waukesha County family case # 16FA597.
Received August 10, 2016, dated August 8, 2016 from Probation/Parole Agent Krystal Gray, regarding visitation, filed with copies of 4 letters
Review hearing on August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on July 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
dated June 14, 2016 from DOC requesting clarification of supervised visitation
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea and Sentencing, October 22, 2015, filed by Erin P. Furgason, RPR

Defendant Lisa A Haefner in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information (for Lisa only).  Attorney Kuchler accepts the amended information and waives a formal reading.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended count #4.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #4.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kuchler makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #4.  
Imposed and stayed Sentence, 
7 months jail without work release privledges,3 days jail credit if revoked
Term of Probation:  2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Sign all Release for Agent;
No contact with Cory Casper;
Supervised placement with MH 12/20/2001 at the discretion of the agent.  
Department of corrections to petition the juvinile court for evaluation done;
Other contact with underage persons be approved by agent. 
Follow any terms and conditions set by any other court regarding minor child. 
Costs: $243.00 bail to be applied, remainder of bail to be refunded to the poster
Condition Time: 20 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence immediately, last 10 of the 20 days to be  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Defendant may have a phone call to arrange child care arrangements.
